content: Hi all - reminder that we have a check in on Tuesday for the SHC Connectathon track participants from 1-2PM UTC (9-10AM ET). Link for the meeting can be found in the Whova agenda under "Introductions and check-in".
Hi @Neelima Karipineni I am new to chat.fhir. Where is "Introductions and check-in" is it a zulip stream? I would love to participate in the Connectathon.

Dragan Sahpaski said:

Hi Neelima Karipineni I am new to chat.fhir. Where is "Introductions and check-in" is it a zulip stream? I would love to participate in the Connectathon.

Hi Dragan -- Neelima is talking aobut Whova, which is the application HL7 uses to manage the Connectathon schedule and Zoom meeting links. There's a link to it at the top of this page: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021+-+05+Connectathon+27. There are also orientation and info session links as well.
Here is a link to the session on Whova: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202105/Agenda/1622892
Thank You all for the answers.
Hi all! As I mentioned on the call, I'm interested in testing out as many SHCs as we can in CommonHealth. Please feel free to reach out if you have an implementation that you'd like to test

FYI, track check-in today at 4:30P ET over Zoom.

I gave up on trying to make ConMan work for recording this track's scenarios - instead we've added reporting to Max's confluence page:
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/SMART+Health+Cards+links+and+tools.

Please take a look and if you're feeling brave try to update with test results.

I like the giant table ;-)

@Neelima Karipineni any idea why your name shows up when I click one of the "pass" or "partial" (etc) pills?

image.png
I've added https://c19.cards to the testing matrix; it should support QRs, File Download, and FHIR API with SMART on FHIR authz (https://c19.cards/api/fhir/ is the base URL)
@Josh Mandel I had to create a set in some macro to make the dropdown work, I think it's just letting you know your choices came from my custom set.
Reminder that wrap-up session today is on the early side 2:30P ET (6:30P UTC).
Wrap-up starting now, please join if you can.

James Kizer said:

Hi all! As I mentioned on the call, I'm interested in testing out as many SHCs as we can in CommonHealth. Please feel free to reach out if you have an implementation that you'd like to test

Hey James, have you been able to test Evernorth implementation in CommonHealth app?
Is there a repository of various SMART Health Cards produced during the connectathon? I'm having a hard time finding any.
shc-file.json
This one works great, except that I can't verify the signature (can't get the public keys). Are there lab result SHCs available?
You should be able to create one on https://connectathon.vci.org/
I'd be interested to test lab cards others have created :smile:
Day 2 wrap-up now at https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202109/Agenda/1910420
oh. @Pascal Pfiffner I generated that locally, but the key is at http://test.fhir.org/r4/.well-known/jwks.json
